bibl.title: Sappho as Aphrodite's Singer, Poet, and Hero(ine): The Reconstruction of the Context and Sense of the Kypris Song.
The Newest Sappho: P. Sapph. Obbink and P. GC inv. 105, Frs. 1-4 = Studies in Archaic and Classical Greek Song. 2

bibl.note: P. Coll. privées: P. Green Inv. 105 (= M.-P.3 1445.01; LDAB 341738) + P. Coll. privées [P. Sapph. Obbink] (= M.-P.3 1445.02; LDAB 341738). - Structure, Texture, and Meaning of the Kypris Song. - Monodic reconstructions of the beginning: Aphrodite's refusal to love Sappho? - Back to Obbink's reconstruction and the remaining lines: choral performance. - Some thoughts regarding its link to the Brothers Song, original setting, and secondary reperformance in the symposium. - Conclusion.
